column4: hown can I orevent the pannel popping up when I move the cursor to the left on 12.04
turn up the sensitivity on the panel?
s/up/down/
yes - helps - but not enough - want to really stop it 100%
don't use Unity then
you could use gnome-shell or something
!notunity | MagicJ
how do I easily turn it off
by not using Unity, but using gnome-shell
you either have it autohide or you dont in which case it'll always be there
you can change *where* it shows up (left side / bottom), but if you want it to autohide but not respond to being tapped, you might be out of luck

ty so much - that's how it seemed - YUCK - I will o the drop back to gnome I guess - this is the tupe of thing that will drive me and others away from Ubuntu - I have 131 sites running Ubuntu that I will probably end up changing because of this type of thing
you could make it go to the bottom
or just make it so its always visible and not hidden
my users do not want to be confused by this stuff.  They use the few things we have on the desktop and no more
the dash is part of Unity.  to not have the dash, the answer  is don't use Unity, but use Gnome Shell or Gnome Classic (I am partial to gnome shell)
I agree - and the best way to that is to change to another distro
or use Gnome Shell (which is closer to Gnome than Unity)
Ubuntu's a great distro, you could use Kubuntu (KDE) if you want
when i get tired of Unity, i keep KDE around :P
I like unity for my own development use  -but for a "packaged system" ready for the end user for whom I really want to hide that there is an OS there at all this is bo good
